description: Information about the donor organism from which a specimen was collected.
title: Donor organism
name: donor_organism

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

schema_type.description: The type of the metadata schema entity.

provenance.description: Provenance information added or generated at time of ingest.
provenance.title: Provenance
provenance.name: provenance

submission_date.description: When project was first submitted to database.

submitter_id.description: ID of individual who first submitted project.

updater_id.description: ID of individual who last updated project.

document_id.comment: This structure supports the current ingest API. It may change in the future.

accession.description: A unique accession for this entity, provided by the broker.

biomaterial_core.description: Information about any biological material that was generated/used in the project including everything from a whole organism to subcellular components.
biomaterial_core.title: Biomaterial core
biomaterial_core.name: biomaterial_core

biomaterial_id.description: A unique ID for the biomaterial.

biomaterial_name.description: A short, descriptive name for the biomaterial that need not be unique.

biomaterial_description.description: A general description of the biomaterial.

supplementary_files.description: A list of filenames of biomaterial-level supplementary files.

biosd_biomaterial.guidelines: Enter ID if sample has been archived. ID can be from the DDBJ, NCBI, or EMBL-EBI and must start with SAMD, SAMN, or SAME, respectively.

insdc_biomaterial.description: An International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) sample accession.
insdc_biomaterial.guidelines: Enter accession if sample has been archived. Accession can be from the DDBJ, NCBI, or EMBL-EBI and must start with DRS, SRS, or ERS, respecitvely.

human_specific.description: Information specific to a donor that is a human (Homo sapiens).
human_specific.title: Human-specific
human_specific.name: human_specific

body_mass_index.description: The body mass index of the donor.

items.description: A term that may be associated with a ethnicity-related ontology term
items.title: Ethnicity ontology
items.name: ethnicity_ontology

text.description: The ethnicity of the human donor.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field

ethnicity.guidelines: Enter one or more ethnicities, separated by a comma.

mouse_specific.description: Information specific to an organism that is a mouse (Mus musculus).
mouse_specific.title: Mouse-specific
mouse_specific.name: mouse_specific

strain.description: The name of the mouse strain.

items.description: A term that may be associated with a strain-related ontology term
items.title: Strain ontology
items.name: strain_ontology

text.description: The name of the strain to which the organism belongs (mouse-specific).

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field

genus_species.description: The scientific binomial name for the species of the organism.

items.description: A term that may be associated with a species-related ontology term
items.title: Species ontology
items.name: species_ontology

text.description: The name of the species to which the organism belongs.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field

sex.description: The biological sex of the organism.
sex.example: Should be one of: male, female, mixed, or unknown.

is_living.description: Whether organism was alive at time of biomaterial collection.
is_living.example: Should be one of: yes, no, unknown.
is_living.guidelines: Enter yes if organism was alive at time of biomaterial collection, no if organism was dead, unknown if not known.

organism_age.description: Age of organism in Age units measured since birth.
organism_age.guidelines: Enter either a single value or a range of values. Indicate a range using a hyphen.

organism_age_unit.description: A term that may be associated with a time unit-related ontology term
organism_age_unit.title: Time unit ontology
organism_age_unit.name: time_unit_ontology

text.description: The name of a time unit being used.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field

development_stage.description: A term that may be associated with a development stage-related ontology term
development_stage.title: Development stage ontology
development_stage.name: development_stage_ontology

text.description: The name of the development stage of the organism.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field

diseases.description: Short description of known disease(s) of the organism.

items.description: A term that may be associated with a disease-related ontology term
items.title: Disease ontology
items.name: disease_ontology

text.description: The text for the term as the user provides it.

ontology.description: An optional ontology reference in format where prefix_ indicates which ontology

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field

death.description: Information relating to the death of an organism.
death.title: Death
death.name: death

cause_of_death.example: Hypoxic brain damage; Sudden cardiac arrest
cause_of_death.guidelines: Determined from death report for human donor or from research lab for mouse.

cold_perfused.description: Whether perfusion with cold fluid was used to help preserve tissues before heart stopped.
cold_perfused.example: Should be one of: yes, no.
cold_perfused.guidelines: Enter yes if cold perfused. Otherwise, enter no.

days_on_ventilator.description: Number of days on ventilator before death occurred.

hardy_scale.description: Value on 4-point Hardy scale cause of death classification.
hardy_scale.guidelines: Enter: 0 for ventilator case, 1 for violent and fast death, 2 for fast death of natural causes, 3 for intermediate death, or 4 for slow death.

time_of_death.description: Date and time when death was declared.
time_of_death.guidelines: Enter the time in date-time format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ.

organ_donation_death_type.description: Type of death preceding organ donation.
organ_donation_death_type.example: Should be one of: Donation after circulatory death (DCD), or Donation after brainstem death (DBD).
organ_donation_death_type.guidelines: Enter value for organ donors only.

normothermic_regional_perfusion.description: Whether entire body was perfused with warm oxygenated blood.
normothermic_regional_perfusion.example: Should be one of: yes, no, or unknown.
normothermic_regional_perfusion.guidelines: Enter yes if entire body (but not limbs) was perfused with warm oxygenated blood. Otherwise, enter no.

familial_relationship.description: Information about other organisms related to this organism.

items.description: Information about other organisms that this organism is related to.
items.title: Familial relationship
items.name: familial_relationship

parent.guidelines: Enter the ID of the parent of this individual.

child.guidelines: Enter the ID of the child of this individual.

sibling.guidelines: Enter the ID of the sibling of this individual.

medical_history.description: Information about the medical history of a donor.
medical_history.title: Medical history
medical_history.name: medical_history

alcohol_history.description: Estimated amount of alcohol consumed per day.
alcohol_history.guidelines: Enter the amount consumed per day using units such as alcohol units (10mL or 8g of alcohol) or drinks (14g of alcohol).

medication.description: Medications the individual was taking at time of biomaterial collection.
medication.guidelines: Enter the medication and dosage. Separate multiple medications with commas.

smoking_history.description: Estimated number of cigarettes smoked per day.
smoking_history.guidelines: Enter an estimated number of cigarettes smoked per day and for how many years.

nutritional_state.description: Nutritional state of individual at time of biomaterial collection.
nutritional_state.example: Should be one of: normal, fasting, or feeding tube removed.

test_results.description: Results from medical tests performed on the individual.

treatment.description: Treatments the individual has undergone prior to biomaterial collection.

gestational_age.description: Gestational age of organism in Gestational age units measured since fertilization.
gestational_age.guidelines: Enter either a single value or a range of values. Indicate a range using a hyphen.

gestational_age_unit.description: A term that may be associated with a time unit-related ontology term
gestational_age_unit.title: Time unit ontology
gestational_age_unit.name: time_unit_ontology

text.description: The name of a time unit being used.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field

height.description: Height of organism in Height unit.
height.guidelines: Enter either a single value or a range of values. Indicate a range using a hyphen.

height_unit.description: A term that may be associated with a cell type-related ontology term
height_unit.title: Length unit ontology
height_unit.name: length_unit_ontology

text.description: The name of a length unit being used.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field

weight.description: Weight of organism in Weight unit.
weight.guidelines: Enter either a single value or a range of values. Indicate a range using a hyphen.

weight_unit.description: A term that may be associated with a cell type-related ontology term
weight_unit.title: Mass unit ontology
weight_unit.name: mass_unit_ontology

text.description: The name of a mass unit being used.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field

timecourse_value.description: The numerical value in Timecourse unit associated with a time interval used in the experiment.

timecourse_unit.description: A term that may be associated with a time unit-related ontology term
timecourse_unit.title: Time unit ontology
timecourse_unit.name: time_unit_ontology

text.description: The name of a time unit being used.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field

timecourse_relevance.description: Relevance of the Timecourse value/unit to the experiment.
timecourse_relevance.example: Collection after tumor cells injected into the mammary gland.
